sample_sentence_patterns: Seen leaving the area in a {color} {make} {model}; {notes}.
Investigators are looking for a {color} {make} {model} bearing {license}, last seen near the scene.

vehicle_ownership_patterns: Use of a motor vehicle parked close to the residence; in many cases, the vehicle is owned by or routinely available to the offender
Occasional use of rental cars, borrowed vehicles, or rarely stolen vehicles to transport the victim
Private motor vehicles (cars, trucks) used to move victims along highways and to and from parking lots and other locations
vehicle_proximity: Short movements from the residence to a nearby parked vehicle
Vehicle owned by or routinely available to the offender

vehicle_types_by_motive.sexual: Local vehicles (owned or routinely available), parked close to residence. Short vehicle trips within the same general area.
vehicle_types_by_motive.custodial: Owned vehicles, rental cars, or borrowed vehicles for longer-distance travel, including interstate movement
vehicle_types_by_motive.trafficking: Highway vehicles, rental cars, and vehicles used for long-distance transport along transportation routes
vehicle_types_by_motive.stranger: Various vehicle types, can include rental or borrowed vehicles to avoid detection

vehicle_characteristics: Owned vehicles (most common for local abductions)
Rental cars (used to avoid detection, especially in custodial cases)
Borrowed vehicles (less traceable than owned vehicles)
Stolen vehicles (rare, but used in some cases)
Temporary paper tags (may indicate rental or recently purchased vehicle)
